etymologies: Middle English: from Old French pome grenate, from pome ‘apple’ + grenate ‘pomegranate’ (from Latin (malum) granatum ‘(apple) having many seeds’, from granum ‘seed’)

definitions: an orange-sized fruit with a tough reddish outer skin and sweet red gelatinous flesh containing many seeds.
shortDefinitions: spherical fruit with tough golden-orange outer skin

definitions: the tree that bears the pomegranate, which is native to North Africa and western Asia and has long been cultivated.
shortDefinitions: tree that bears pomegranate, native to North Africa and western Asia
